questions.question: Statements: All bags are cakes. All lamps are cakes.  Conclusions:  I. Some lamps are bags.   II. No lamp is bag.
questions.explain: Since the middle term 'cakes' is not distributed even once in the premises, no definite conclusion follows. However, I and II involve only the extreme terms and form a complementary pair. So, either I or II follows.

questions.question: Statements: All mangoes are golden in colour. No golden-coloured things are cheap.  Conclusions:  I.    All mangoes are cheap.  II.  Golden-coloured mangoes are not cheap.
questions.explain: Clearly, the conclusion must be universal negative and should not contain the middle term. So, it follows that 'No mango is cheap'. Since all mangoes are golden in colour, we may substitute 'mangoes' with 'golden-coloured mangoes'. Thus, II follows.

questions.question: Statements: Some kings are queens. All queens are beautiful.  Conclusions:    I.  All kings are beautiful.  II.  All queens are kings.
questions.explain: Since one premise is particular, the conclusion must be particular. So, neither I nor II follows.

questions.question: Statements: Some doctors are fools. Some fools are rich.  Conclusions:   I.  Some doctors are rich. II.  Some rich are doctors.
questions.explain: Since both the premises are particular, no definite conclusion follows.

questions.question: What protocol does PPP use to identify the Network layer protocol?
questions.explain: Network Control Protocol is used to help identify the Network layer protocol used in the packet..

questions.question: Which of the following commands will allow you to set your Telnet password on a Cisco router?
questions.explain: The command line vty 0 4 places you in a prompt that will allow you to set or change your Telnet password.

questions.question: Which protocol does DHCP use at the Transport layer?
questions.explain: User Datagram Protocol is a connection network service at the Transport layer, and DHCP uses this connectionless service.

questions.question: Which command is used to determine if an IP access list is enabled on a particular interface?
questions.explain: The show ip interface command will show you if any outbound or inbound interfaces have an access list set.

questions.question: Where is a hub specified in the OSI model?
questions.explain: Hubs regenerate electrical signals, which are specified at the Physical layer.

questions.question: What does the passive command provide to dynamic routing protocols?
questions.optiona: Stops an interface from sending or receiving periodic dynamic updates.
questions.optionb: Stops an interface from sending periodic dynamic updates but not from receiving updates.
questions.optionc: Stops the router from receiving any dynamic updates.
questions.optiond: Stops the router from sending any dynamic updates.
questions.explain: The passive command, short for passive-interface, stops regular updates from being sent out an interface. However, the interface can still receive updates.

questions.question: Which protocol is used to send a destination network unknown message back to originating hosts?
questions.explain: ICMP is the protocol at the Network layer that is used to send messages back to an originating router.

questions.question: How often are BPDUs sent from a layer 2 device?
questions.explain: Every 2 seconds, BPDUs are sent out from all active bridge ports by default.

questions.question: How many broadcast domains are created when you segment a network with a 12-port switch?
questions.explain: By default, switches break up collision domains but are one large broadcast domain.

questions.question: What does the command routerA(config)#line cons 0 allow you to perform next?
questions.explain: The command line console 0 places you at a prompt where you can then set your console user-mode password.

questions.question: Which router command allows you to view the entire contents of all access lists?
questions.explain: To see the contents of all access lists, use the show access-lists command.

questions.question: Which class of IP address has the most host addresses available by default?
questions.explain: Class A addressing provides 24 bits for host addressing.

questions.question: In a network with dozens of switches, how many root bridges would you have?
questions.explain: You should have only one root bridge per network.

questions.question: What PPP protocol provides dynamic addressing, authentication, and multilink?
questions.explain: Link Control Protocol in the PPP stack provides dynamic addressing, authentication, and multilink.

questions.question: What is a stub network?
questions.optiona: A network with more than one exit point.
questions.optionb: A network with more than one exit and entry point.
questions.optionc: A network with only one entry and no exit point.
questions.optiond: A network that has only one entry and exit point.
questions.explain: Stub networks have only one connection to an internetwork. Only default routes can be set on a stub network or network loops may occur.

questions.question: If your router is facilitating a CSU/DSU, which of the following commands do you need to use to provide the router with a 64000bps serial link?
questions.explain: The clock rate command is two words, and the speed of the line is in bps.

questions.question: Which one of the following is true regarding VLANs?
questions.optiona: Two VLANs are configured by default on all Cisco switches.
questions.optionb: VLANs only work if you have a complete Cisco switched internetwork. No off-brand switches are allowed.
questions.optionc: You should not have more than 10 switches in the same VTP domain.
questions.optiond: VTP is used to send VLAN information to switches in a configured VTP domain.
questions.explain: Switches do not propagate VLAN information by default; you must configure the VTP domain. VLAN Trunking Protocol (VTP) is used to propagate VLAN information across a trunk link.

questions.question: What does a VLAN do?
questions.optiona: Acts as the fastest port to all servers.
questions.optionb: Provides multiple collision domains on one switch port.
questions.optionc: Breaks up broadcast domains in a layer 2 switch internetwork.
questions.optiond: Provides multiple broadcast domains within a single collision domain.
questions.explain: VLANs break up broadcast domains at layer 2.

questions.question: What is the main reason the OSI model was created?
questions.optiona: To create a layered model larger than the DoD model.
questions.optionb: So application developers can change only one layer's protocols at a time.
questions.optiond: So Cisco could use the model.
questions.explain: The primary reason the OSI model was created was so that different networks could inter-operate.

questions.question: How many collision domains are created when you segment a network with a 12-port switch?
questions.explain: Layer 2 switching creates individual collision domains.

questions.question: What command will display the line, protocol, DLCI, and LMI information of an interface?
questions.explain: The show interface command shows the line, protocol, DLCI, and LMI information of an interface.

questions.question: Which protocol does Ping use?
questions.explain: ICMP is the protocol at the Network layer that is used to send echo requests and replies.

questions.question: Which command is used to upgrade an IOS on a Cisco router?
questions.explain: The copy tftp flash command places a new file in flash memory, which is the default location for the Cisco IOS in Cisco routers.

questions.question: If you wanted to delete the configuration stored in NVRAM, what would you type?
questions.explain: The command erase startup-config deletes the configuration stored in NVRAM.

questions.question:
What protocols are used to configure trunking on a switch?
1. VLAN Trunking protocol
2. VLAN
3. 802.1Q
4. ISL
questions.explain: VTP is not right because it has nothing to do with trunking except that it sends VLAN information across a trunk link. 802.1Q and ISL are used to configure trunking on a port.

questions.question: Which of the following commands sets the secret password to Cisco?
questions.explain: The enable secret password is case sensitive, so the second option is wrong. To set the enable secret <password>, use the enable secret <password> command from global configuration mode.

questions.question: You type the following command into the router and receive the following output:  Router#show serial 0/0         ^ % Invalid input detected at '^' marker.  Why was this error message displayed?
questions.optiona: You need to be in privileged mode.
questions.optionb: You cannot have a space between serial and 0/0.
questions.optionc: The router does not have a serial0/0 interface.
questions.optiond: Part of the command is missing.
questions.explain: You can view the interface statistics from user mode, but the command is show interface serial 0/0.

questions.question:
Which of the following commands will display the current IP addressing and the layer 1 and 2 status of an interface?
1. show version     2. show protocols     3. show interfaces    4. show controllers   5. show ip interface
questions.explain: The commands show protocols, show interfaces, and show ip interface will show you the layer 1 and 2 status and the IP addresses of your router's interfaces.

questions.question: You type show running-config and get this output:  [output cut] Line console 0     Exec-timeout 1 35     Password BIXPASSWD     Login [output cut]  What do the two numbers following the exec-timeout command mean?
questions.optiona: If no command has been typed in 35 seconds, the console connection will be closed.
questions.optionb: If no router activity has been detected in 1 hour and 35 minutes, the console will be locked out.
questions.optionc: If no commands have been typed in 1 minute and 35 seconds, the console connection will be closed.
questions.optiond: If you're connected to the router by a Telnet connection, input must be detected within 1 minute and 35 seconds or the connection will be closed.
questions.explain: The exec-timeout command is set in minutes and seconds.

questions.question: What layer of the OSI model would you assume the problem is in if you type show interface serial 1 and receive the following message? "Serial1 is down, line protocol is down."
questions.optiond: None. It is a router problem.
questions.explain: If you see that a serial interface and the protocol are both down, then you have a Physical layer problem. If you see serial1 is up, line protocol is down, then you are not receiving (Data Link) keepalives from the remote end.

questions.question: Which of the following commands displays the configurable parameters and statistics of all interfaces on a router?
questions.explain: With the show interfaces command, you can view the configurable parameters, get statistics for the interfaces on the router, verify if the interfaces are shut down, and see the IP address of each interface.

questions.question: Which of the following commands will configure all the default VTY ports on a router?
questions.explain: From global configuration mode, use the line vty 0 4 command to set all five default VTY lines.

questions.question: You need to find the broadcast address used on a LAN on your router. What command will you type into the router from user mode to find the broadcast address?
questions.explain: The command show ip protocols will actually show you the broadcast address for each interface - too bad it isn't a possible answer. Your best answer is show interfaces, which will provide the IP address and mask for each interface.

questions.question: Which command will delete the contents of NVRAM on a router?
questions.explain: The erase startup-config command erases the contents of NVRAM and will put you in setup mode if the router is restarted.

questions.question: What keystroke will terminate setup mode?
questions.explain: You can exit setup mode at any time by using the keystroke Ctrl+C.

questions.question:
Which of the following services use TCP?
1. DHCP
2. SMTP
3. HTTP
4. TFTP
5. FTP
questions.explain: SMTP, HTTP and FTP use TCP.

questions.question: What layer in the TCP/IP stack is equivalent to the Transport layer of the OSI model?
questions.explain: The four layers of the TCP/IP stack (also called the DoD model) are Application/Process, Host-to-Host, Internet, and Network Access. The Host-to-Host layer is equivalent to the Transport layer of the OSI model.

questions.question: Which of the following describe the DHCP Discover message?    It uses FF:FF:FF:FF:FF:FF as a layer 2 broadcast.     It uses UDP as the Transport layer protocol.     It uses TCP as the Transport layer protocol.     It does not use a layer 2 destination add
questions.explain: A client that sends out a DHCP Discover message in order to receive an IP address sends out a broadcast at both layer 2 and layer 3. The layer 2 broadcast is all Fs in hex, or FF:FF:FF:FF:FF:FF. The layer 3 broadcast is 255.255.255.255, which means all ne

questions.question: You want to implement a mechanism that automates the IP configuration, including IP address, subnet mask, default gateway, and DNS information. Which protocol will you use to accomplish this?
questions.explain: Dynamic Host Configuration Protocol (DHCP) is used to provide IP information to hosts on your network. DHCP can provide a lot of information, but the most common is IP address, subnet mask, default gateway, and DNS information.

questions.question: Which of the following is private IP address?
questions.explain: Class A private address range is 10.0.0.0 through 10.255.255.255. Class B private address range is 172.16.0.0 through 172.31.255.255, and Class C private address range is 192.168.0.0 through 192.168.255.255.

questions.question: Which of the following allows a router to respond to an ARP request that is intended for a remote host?
questions.explain: Proxy ARP can help machines on a subnet reach remote subnets without configuring routing or a default gateway.

questions.question: The DoD model (also called the TCP/IP stack) has four layers. Which layer of the DoD model is equivalent to the Network layer of the OSI model?
questions.explain: The four layers of the DoD model are Application/Process, Host-to-Host, Internet, and Network Access. The Internet layer is equivalent to the Network layer of the OSI model.

questions.question: Which of the following services use UDP?      DHCP     SMTP     SNMP     FTP     HTTP     TFTP
questions.explain: DHCP, SNMP, and TFTP use UDP.

questions.question: Which class of IP address provides a maximum of only 254 host addresses per network ID?
questions.explain: A Class C network address has only 8 bits for defining hosts: 28 - 2 = 254.

questions.question: If you use either Telnet or FTP, which is the highest layer you are using to transmit data?
questions.explain: Both FTP and Telnet use TCP at the Transport layer; however, they both are Application layer protocols, so the Application layer is the best answer.

questions.question: SCD, TEF, UGH, ____, WKL
questions.explain: There are two alphabetical series here. The first series is with the first letters only: STUVW. The second series involves the remaining letters: CD, EF, GH, IJ, KL.
questions.Directions: In these series, you will be looking at both the letter pattern and the number pattern. Fill the blank in the middle of the series or end of the series.

questions.question: B2CD, _____, BCD4, B5CD, BC6D
questions.explain: Because the letters are the same, concentrate on the number series, which is a simple 2, 3, 4, 5, 6 series, and follows each letter in order.

questions.question: FAG, GAF, HAI, IAH, ____
questions.explain: The middle letters are static, so concentrate on the first and third letters. The series involves an alphabetical order with a reversal of the letters. The first letters are in alphabetical order: F, G, H, I , J. The second and fourth segments are reversa

questions.question: ELFA, GLHA, ILJA, _____, MLNA
questions.explain: The second and forth letters in the series, L and A, are static. The first and third letters consist of an alphabetical order beginning with the letter E.

questions.question: CMM, EOO, GQQ, _____, KUU
questions.explain: The first letters are in alphabetical order with a letter skipped in between each segment: C, E, G, I, K. The second and third letters are repeated; they are also in order with a skipped letter: M, O, Q, S, U.

questions.question: ZA5, Y4B, XC6, W3D, _____
questions.explain: There are three series to look for here. The first letters are alphabetical in reverse: Z, Y, X, W, V. The second letters are in alphabetical order, beginning with A. The number series is as follows: 5, 4, 6, 3, 7.

questions.question: QPO, NML, KJI, _____, EDC
questions.explain: This series consists of letters in a reverse alphabetical order.

questions.question: JAK, KBL, LCM, MDN, _____
questions.explain: This is an alternating series in alphabetical order. The middle letters follow the order ABCDE. The first and third letters are alphabetical beginning with J. The third letter is repeated as a first letter in each subsequent three-letter segment.

questions.question: BCB, DED, FGF, HIH, ___
questions.explain: This series consists of a simple alphabetical order with the first two letters of all segments: B, C, D, E, F, G, H, I, J, K. The third letter of each segment is a repetition of the first letter.

questions.question: P5QR, P4QS, P3QT, _____, P1QV
questions.explain: The first two letters, PQ, are static. The third letter is in alphabetical order, beginning with R. The number series is in descending order beginning with 5.

questions.question: Applying for Seasonal Employment occurs when a person requests to be considered for a job that is dependent on a particular season or time of year. Which situation below is the best example of Applying for Seasonal Employment?
questions.optiona: The ski instructors at Top of the Peak Ski School work from December through March.
questions.optionb: Matthew prefers jobs that allow him to work outdoors.
questions.optionc: Lucinda makes an appointment with the beach resort restaurant manager to interview for the summer waitressing position that was advertised in the newspaper.
questions.optiond: Doug's ice cream shop stays open until 11 p.m. during the summer months.
questions.explain: Although the ski instructors at Top of the Peak Ski School do work seasonally, choice a does not describe anyone applying for seasonal employment. In choice b, the statement that Matthew likes to work outdoors tells us nothing about seasonal employment or
questions.Directions: Read each definition and all four choices carefully, and find the answer that provides the best example of the given definition.

questions.question: Violating an Apartment Lease occurs when a tenant does something prohibited by the legally binding document that he or she has signed with a landlord. Which situation below is the best example of Violating an Apartment Lease?
questions.optiona: Tim has decided to move to another city, so he calls his landlord to tell him that he is not interested in renewing his lease when it expires next month.
questions.optionb: Valerie recently lost her job and, for the last three months, has neglected to pay her landlord the monthly rent they agreed upon in writing when she moved into her apartment eight months ago.
questions.optionc: Mark writes a letter to his landlord that lists numerous complaints about the apartment he has agreed to rent for two years.

questions.optiona: To educate readers about the healththreats involved in the use ofperformance-enhancing drugs
questions.optionb: To analyze the ways in which professionalathletes have eluded attempts to screenfor performance-enhancing drugs
questions.optionc: To discuss the reasons why performanceenhancingdrugs are a dangerous andpersistent problem for society
questions.optiond: To complain about the inadequate effortsby government and professional sportsorganizations to eliminate the problem ofperformance-enhancing drugs
questions.optione: To argue that athletes, both professionaland amateur, should not useperformance-enhancing drugs on the grounds that they are both dangerous andunfair
questions.Directions:
Nonprescription anabolic steroids have been illegal
in the United States since 1991, and most professional
sports leagues have banned them since the
1980s. These bans are partly a matter of fairnessa
talented athlete trained to the peak of her ability
simply cannot compete with an equivalent athlete
using steroidsbut also based on issues of health.
Anabolic androgenic steroids (anabolic means
that they build tissues; androgenic means that they
increase masculine traits) have been linked to liver
damage, kidney tumors, high blood pressure,
balding, and acne. They function by increasing the
bodys level of testosterone, the primary male sex
hormone. In men, this dramatic increase in testosterone
can lead to the shrinking of testicles, infertility,
and the development of breasts; in women, it
can lead to the growth of facial hair and permanent
damage to the reproductive system. Steroids
have also been linked to a range of psychological
problems, including depression an
